lexUnit.name: silent.a

corpus.description: Wall Street Journal Texts from the PropBank Project
corpus.name: PropBank

lexUnit.definition: COD: not prone to speak much

sentence.text: Political honours are either an almost contemptuous gesture towards those who have kept silent when their consciences might have told them to vote against a government bill , or a reward for money or advice .

He remained silent when the government decided to extend the period of contribution required for a full state pension , thereby calling into question the right to retire at 60 , introduced by the Socialists .
And the Labour Party has been remarkably silent about this lack of trade union affiliation .
Anglo-Welsh have been conspicuously silent about their intentions with regard to the continued employment of our workforce .
A PENSIVE Prince Charles ventures a wry smile yesterday , staying silent about his friendship with Camilla Parker Bowles .
The written sources are almost silent about the subject of internal trade , just as the details of overseas trade do not match the volume of archaeological evidence .

Not all men are defensive or get upset if you raise this subject ; keeping silent about your concerns may put both your health and well-being at risk and wo n't help your relationship in the long term .
` You will remain completely silent about this , Herr Schiller , " said von Starnberg .
The Act is silent about the criteria for admission to membership .
But that English sources are silent about Hiring and trouble in the north in the 980s is not particularly significant : there is much silence in the early history of Northumbria .
He said he had remained silent about Mr Naqvi being held but would now speak .
However Gore pointed out that it was silent on the ` characteristic doctrines of Calvinism and many of those [ doctrines ] most associated with popular Protestantism " .
Wilkins even argued that where Scripture was silent on a given issue -- the plurality of worlds , for example -- this was license to consider the possibility , not to exclude it .
The Rules of the Supreme Court appear to be silent on this topic .
Accounting texts are silent on this issue .
Both parents remained silent under questioning and , that being the whole of the evidence , neither could be convicted .
Politicians are also largely silent on how the next government will be able to carry out spending plans in view of the state of the productive economy .
This interpretation of the doctrine is silent on whether individual political action ( voting in elections etc. ) may rightly aim at the promotion of some conception of the good .
THE Bible teaches us how to behave to the sinner that repents , but stays understandably silent on how to deal with the prince who breaks the Church 's rules .
At St. Mary 's Church in Ilminster , Somerset , the bells have fallen silent following a dust-up over church attendance .
